reviewText:
Early Access Review

FOR THE DEVS:
The game needs several improvements to make it more playable:
-A better inventory system. For instance we should be able to put a gun in our inventory. We should also be able to remove clothes by hand
-The needs system needs to improved. For instance my character is on the verge of dying every 5 minutes. Be it dehydration or starvation, it should be less unforgiving.
-It would be nice to have servers for english speaking players and for russian players. Till now I've only met 2 english players. Since I don't speak russian it's hard for me to communicate with the other survivors.
-Add actual character customization. Don't tell me it's a feature when it isn't even in the game.
-It would be nice to have my fist as a weapon.
-A global chat function would be nice. Some people don't own mics.
-And please hire an actual native english speaking employee. Google translate items are tedious.

The game is actually fun and I enjoy it. Keep up the good work.

These are just my two cents. Please like so the devs can see.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Firstly, I would like to point out that the follow points are constructively criticising the game in order to get it out of that early alpha stage. NOTE: This game doesn't have zombies in it, so if you are buying it hoping for that then you're out of luck

The good points:
• Considering how new the game is, the gun play is extremely 'solid' for lack of a better phrase to describe how smooth it can feel.
• The game is very well optimized, I run it at 1080p on a GTX 750 Ti paired with an i7 4790 to remove bottlenecking and I receive a solid 60 fps on maximum settings without any FPS lag whatsoever.
• There is a nice amount of guns already, it has overtaken the DayZ Standalone given the amount of time the developers have put into it and I have a feeling that it will grow exponentially as soon as big Youtubers hear about it and start to play it.
• The map is quite a nice size, you will have to run for a while to reach the end of the map. Whether you recieve better gear or not is really dependant on your luck.
• The weather is a very nice side feature as well as a *NON-BUGGY* (I can't stress that enough when compared to DayZ) eating, and heat system.
• The servers are stable enough and easy to set up and ones which you join aren't too laggy depending on your connection. (The combat sometimes get's slightly laggy, but hey ho)

The Bad Points:
• The only AI Enemies in the game are dogs, this by itself is fine, but there is definitely a problem with them. They spawn in packs in certain areas such as the military base and many other places far away from the generic new player spawn (very South of the map). Usually, this would feel nice and challenging but the problem generates when no loot is actually spawned at the military base apart from an odd M1911 magazine with 4 bullets in it. Whoopee.. This can be tested by creating a fresh server with brand new shiny loot (Dare I say), and you will see that there are too many dogs considering the lack of good loot. To improve, reverse their spawns and make them spawn in the wild and not near what was once human civilisation to encourage players not to wander off.
• The melee combat is for one, dubious. It seems that the hit boxes on enemies and dogs in particular are very tiny, and in order for you to deal some damage, you need to be within licking range, fair enough for man to man combat, but when it comes to dogs, it's a big no no when you think about how many you will have to kill.
• The heat system is too unforgiving. Staying inside with a jacket on still lowers your temperature, and once it gets to roughly 25 degress ᶜᶦᵗᵃᵗᶦᵒᶰ ᶰᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ your health starts to slowly decrease. The second part I don't have a problem with, but the only way to get your temperature is to create a fire which requires an axe to get firewood, lighter fluid (I think?) and a lighter. The chance of finding everything for that is pretty slim
• Similar to the heat system, the health system is VERY unforgiving. Running into dogs and surviving will probably take your health down the the 'Wounded' or 'Severely Wounded' stage. The only way to get your health back up is to take medicine of some description which is recognised by a generic 'Bottle o' Peels' and those pills are.. Yes you guessed it.. Extremely Rare. To improve this, they should allow your health to regenerate slowly as long as your other basic needs are satisfied.
• There isn't a full tutorial for noobs who have no clue what they're doing. Some people who have played a lot of survival games take to it very quickly, but they will soon come to a halt somewhere. For instance, the weapon reloading system in itself is quite complicated at first, but you can get the hang of it. What annoyed me is how some of the guns were in Russian meaning you couldn't understand what they were called and look up their calibre on Wikipedia. Adjacent to the name of the gun, the type of ammo should be displayed so you know exactly what ammo to look out for.
• One teeny tiny point is that my guns seem to not fire exactly when I need them to, and ammo doesn't seem to stack very effectively sometimes. This is more of a minor bug than a problem.
• When you die, sometimes there will be a spectator mode in which you can see everyone meaning if you know one area well, you can track them down if you're lucky enough. Fair enough if you're on other side of the map, but if you're in the spawn then it can become a problem rather quickly. No neeed to explain that one ;-)
• The final point isn't too much of a problem, but the servers seem to sort depending on how many people are actually in them, meaning you can't join a game that your friend has created if it's just them in it. And no, there's no option to join via Steam. This isn't much of a problem but sometimes it's nicer just to have a game with your friends are gear up before venturing into the big, bandity world.

EDITS:
• The guns don't fire because they either 'need oil' or 'need repair' (or broken if heavily used but not maintained)

These are all of the points I have collected so far, and don't be discouraged by the sheer amount of negative comments I have hopefully successfully conveyed. There are far many more good points such as atmosphere and looting system that I could've writtne about, but they're so small individually that they aren't worth it, they do however create a massive difference when put together in an online game.

Overall I definitely recommend this to people who enjoy survival games and are looking to support the developers in order for them to improve this already outstanding game. Dean 'Rocket' Hall can shove that so called effort he has been putting into the DayZ mod up his buttocks and salute these developers who are much closer to the community.

If you wish to ask me any questions about the game, feel free to message me on Steam, I'm not the most experienced person but i'll try my best to answer any questions

-Jacob :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The recent push to beta ruined the game.

You used to be able to roam the snow covered russian land scape, looking for supplies to survive and hoping to find fuel so you can light a log and stay warm for the night.

Not, its a faux spring time texture set right over the old one, with the same sound effects. This is visually appaling, and combined with the horrible layout of the new maps, it is just disgusting.

On top of all of this, the number of servers and players has decreased dramatically. At any given time, there are only 3 servers online, each with 5 people or less on it. This is because now they made strictly russian servers, and strictly english, and one other language. This was a horrible move by developers, and this ruined their american player base. It also removed a fun element from the game

This game went from a solid 4/5 to, at best, a 2/5. The devs should roll back to the aplha version and fix the bugs, and make an anti-cheat that doesnt run on a potato curcuit.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game does have potential, especially at this price, however a few major issues are holding this game back.  First of which is the dehydration mechanic.  For the rarity of finding water the dehydration bar drains much too fast.  It either needs to drain slower or more water/juice/soup needs to be spawned in the game.
The second major problem is the wolves.  Often times I spawn in looking for loot in a building only for a wolf to run in and start attacking me.  If I don't have a weapon there isn't much I can do to defend myself as the character runs out of stamina too quickly and the wolf can easily kill you.  Also the wolves can find you much too easily often I'll be on the second floor of a building and wolves will come from miles away outside, run into the building, climb up the stairs and run into my room.  Again if I haven't found a weapon by that point suicide is the best option because I have no way of getting away.
Also the hit detection seems pretty off, many times I've been in a firefight with someone and shoot them multiple times at close range with a shotgun only for them to switch to an axe and hit me once or twice with it and kill me.
Overall this game is solid for the price.  I have had many fun moments in intense firefights; frantically trying to loot the bodies of the players I has just slain.  Unfortunately these moments are too far and few inbetween and some of the mechanics are so game breaking that I cannot recommend this game until they are addressed.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For what it is I would say that it is worth the 5 dollar price tag and here are the pros and cons.

Pros:
-Game runs at an consistet 60 fps on high
-Large enviroments
-You can search every crook and cranny
-Buildable bases
-Standard FPS controls
-Good weather system
-Most homes you can enter
-Survival is straight foward
-Fun and intense moments
-Gun variety
-Simple inventory
-Large detailed buildings
-ONLY FIVE DOLLARS

Cons:
-Most players are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥S
-Needs more loot
-Needs more animal NPCs
-Finding ammo for the right gun can be difficult
-Needs more game options
-You can get stuck in some areas and buildings
-Sound problems
-needs more variety in sounds
-Needs more things to shoot at besides players and wolves

Compared to games like dayz and H1Z1 this game knows that it is a bit glitchy and doesn't have as much content as other games, so it is reasonaly priced, solid than most survival games, and hackers are a rarety.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is completely worth 5$
The graphics look amazing, and it runs so smoothly.
If you're into DayZ, but don't have the money or the best computer, you should definitely give this game a try.

Pros:
-Graphics are really good
-Runs smoothly on almost any computer
-A lot of people don't KoS (Kill on Sight)
-Just came out, so they're adding new things every day.
-It's fun to create buildings with the crafting system

Cons:
-There aren't options where you can change mouse sensitivity,
-Just came out, and not a lot of people are playing it.
-Animations can be a little weird (Which makes the game fun sometimes)
-You can spectate other players after death, which can cause people to learn where people are, which ruins the survival feeling,

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Really dissapointing. Played just over 6 hours I think, and Im calling it a day. In those hours, I played on the busiest servers, about 8-9 players, and I only ever met one person.  We stood opposite each other, at around 20ft distance, unloaded our guns on each other, and neither of us took any hits!?  I have shot many a charging wolf before you say it is my aim :P
The wolves are a relentless pain, and sometimes you will be spawned next to some, which means you have to run and hope for the best, as you have no ability to punch or kick these hungry little cretins.
Loot is scarce, you'll find yourself sprinting from building to building, searching endless empty cupboards and drawers, before you starve or dehydrate. If your lucky enough to find these resources, you'll probably freeze to death, as this is another element to contend with, and being fully clothed in winter gear and standing in a house is apparently not enough.
Theres loads of bugs, screen goes black whilst the sound continues, getting stuck in floors etc, but I expected these to be fair.
If this game was free, it might be worth a couple of hours of your time, if you have the patience of a saint.  As it currently stands, Id say keep your cash.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nMe & my friend bought the game for the fun of it, and since it was 5 Euro we did, we thought it wouldn't be that good and kinda slagged it, but man this game is fun,exciting and pure  PvP. As soon as me and my friends load up we both started looting and met up very fast, in fact it is really easy to find friends because from what I notice you spawn close to each other at the start. The later on I met another guy in a small cabin and started talking to him, but suddenly 3 Russians came up and started shooting at our cabin. reviewText:
Early Access Review

PLEASE Don't pay any attention to reviews from players with not even 1 hour of play time.. They most likely died because they are ♥♥♥♥ and didn't know what to do.. SURPRISE SURPRISE!!

This game is actually decent. Just earlier I was running around one of the towns and got gunned down.. When I respawned, I was lucky enough to find an old rifle and some ammo close by and walked back to the person looting my gear. I lined him up and BOOM HEADSHOT. Took all of my stuff back and most of his aswell.. It was very intense..

This game has created a very real world feel. There is no chat, which I think is AWESOME. Means you don't get any spam or ♥♥♥♥♥es having a good cry.. There is voice chat for when you are close to someone or if you have a walkie talkie you can talk to anyone in the same town as you..

There are only 2 bad things about this game:

1. There aren't enough players yet to be able to always play against people, sometimes you feel like you are playing solo game..

2. Limited content and small bugs, but hey... It's early alpha, what do you expect? And it's $5.. C'mon.


All in all, it's a fun game and well worth your $5. Give it a good chance, play it for a couple hours, look up some guides if you get stuck. If there was more people giving it a chance then it would be such a fun game for everyone to play!

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME

History of this game as I know it:

Beta: the devs release an open world survival game set in siberia, it is developed to near completion and is a fun game although still has some quirks that need to be worked out.

Summer version: Instead of fixing the game that already exists the devs decide that they want to make a WHOLE NEW GAME that occurs in the summer ( previous game was in winter) so do they take the previous game and reskin the terrain in summer green instead of artic snow? HELL NO they create an ENTIRELY NEW GAME that runs like crap because the whole map is covered with flowers that move in the wind, and devs obviously still havn't figure out how occlusion works. This version goes over like a lead baloon and in response devs DELETE THE ENTIRE FORUM! then they re-release" the old version
date: which still works ok but they don't fix the bugs that people have known about for ever.\n\nCurrent (alpha?) version: Ok never mind that the devs don't know what way the greek alphabet goes ( beta comes after alpha) After almost a year of no communication at all with their community the devs announce the release of an ENTIRELY NEW GAME. Do they return to the best working most popular version of the game and fix teh known issues? HELL NO they release 3 tiny unfinished "sectors" and call it a game. Then they drop off the face of the earth for 2 months.. that brings us here. The game randomly bans people that can play it

I wake up in a prison and walk around grabbing a bunch of empty weapon magazines that I don't know how to load with bullets and an axe

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So far, so good, I just saw the game previews on Youtube, bought it, played it, and for an early alpha, looks great, Still, more needs to be done, Here's one of many of my suggestions:

1 -> NO ZOMBIES.

Seriously, I'm tired of zombie games, please don't add them, add other things, such as bandits for weaponry, scavengers for random loot/tools, Survivors for everyday needs (food).


2  -> More Animals

Yup, we need more meat, more fur, because WINTER IS COMING!
and we need to freak out the cold ice on our bodies.


3 -> Stress System

Well, It would be awesome if you could implement a stress system...
It could be unique for the game... If you hear a wolf howling, it would scare you ingame, and the stress would rise..
You hear footsteps? Well, time take a deep breath, and prepare yourself..
Gunshots? RUN, or face courage yourself...
That way, the more stress you have, the more that your hands would shake..
How do you fix you stress?
Simple, Lighter + cigarettes for the nerves, or a little vodka.
Or, if you ain't a smoker/drinker, try to face your fears/stress, so that your used of your dangerous, that the word ''Stress'' doesn't mean nothing to you anymore.

4 -> You guys need to implement a ''Suggestions'' Board on your steam game's forum, so that people would suggest things for you, so that the game would be well received for us all...
Everyone loves to have their ideas posted, and replied by the game developers.

For now, this would be great addictions for the game, and I hope that the developers would consider my suggestions, along with others suggestions from the community.

I hope, that in the future, I could add even more suggestions, a great hug/kiss for the developers, and I hope that you could construct a FABULOUS game!

7/10 for a great early alpha game

Cheers <3

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I purchased the game today, I have enjoyed it...here is what I have found so far...

1. Lost everything when I had to log out...bummer, had good loot...
2. Mouse wheel changes between melee weapon and ranged weapon
3. G key drops equipped weapon so you can drop revolver you found in drawer and pick up auto pistol you found in another drawer.
4. double right click on ammo in inventory and click on matching ammo in inventory to combine.
5. double right click on ammo in inventory and click on matching magazine in inventory to load magazine
6. so far have not figured out how to put magazine into equiped pistol (maybe dont have correct magazine for the pistol)
7. Do not know how to load rounds into revolver (maybe dont have correct ammo for revolver) R key should be reload, but with no control mapping layout hard to determine and with hitting random keys on the keyboard and no message coming up (wrong ammo for type of weapon equipped) hard to tell.
8. Finding a backpack increases your inventory. YAY!
9. Found gasoline/lighter fluid with second character
10. Found lighter with third character
11. Died by wolf with first character as I could not hit it with my barefists, respawn gave me a baseball bat to restart. Hitting random keys to figure out what key was reload logged me out of my character and sent me back to log in menu where I lost my whole inventory and had to start over (suck!) New character starter with baseball bat. Killed wolf, got meat. Cant cook meat...
12. Found a map!!! shows the area, need to take a screen shot and print it out.
13. Found lots of weapons, lots of food, lots drinks, cant carry them all, get hungry fast, get thirsty fast, cant find a place to rest...cant find a place to save so I dont lose everything when I log out, dont know how to log out without losing everything...cant use beds (or have not found a bed that is usable) found apartment buildings with doors that close, that are safe from elements and wildlife, but can not sit on chairs/sofas or sleep in beds.

I recommend the game for the price, early access, but the game does need a booklet or a screen that covers keyboard commands and maybe a bit of a walkthrough.

***just played after the patch***
Okay, after patch, either I found the correct ammo or R now works to reload and I have correct ammo for the revolver, still dont have an automatic and magazines to check on that aspect yet. Getting cold too fast and this time around not finding any coats, however i did find an axe and hammer and started playing around with building a structure, then someone killed me, respawned and only found an axe so cant play around with the building aspect of the game anymore, but it is kind of fun. gonna check out the help system that was just implemented in the menu and see what that is all about.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For the price you pay for this, it's well worth it! I had some fun and got frustrated at times, but it has so much potential to be a great game, possibly better than DayZ!

Some of my experience so far:

- Spawned naked
- Ran to nearby house
- Looted some cookies and beer (nice)
- Found a shirt and some bi*chin' shorts
- Found a hat
- Found a gun and bullets
- Came across an abandoned apartment building and started looting
- Hear footsteps coming up the stairs, so I draw my pistol and hide behind a table (perfect spot)
- Guy runs in towards me wielding an axe wearing better shorts than me
- I start furiously clicking to try and shoot him, only to find my gun wasn't loaded, and for him recieving a volley of clicks.
- He strikes me twice, I let out a blood-curdling scream, then die.
- Then as I gaze down upon my precious collection of cookies, beer, a gun and other items, I can't help but feel a little bit sad
- He took my gun, beer, and my damn cookies...

So that was my first experience, but I can say I'm quite impressed from what I saw. This game has a lot of potential and I am glad I contributed towards it. I just hope the developers won't abandon what could be an excellent game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The developers thought they needed to start from scratch with a new game, people FREAKED OUT.
So they changed their minds, seeing we didn't want that, and they are working on a really big update that they are going to push any day. They have been releasing frequent updates and pictures. It seems like they are doing everything right, but people are just really upset from that initial shock of them wanting to abandon it.
They changed their plans because of how we reacted, and that shows that they aren't just looking for a cash-grab. Ignore all the people slinging the hate comments because of 'abandonment'.

It's early access, and they treat it like early access. They are working on it.
These devs try really hard. I think it's terrible that people are so angry at them still, even though they saw the error of their ways and did exactly what we were asking, which was more updates.
Give the devs a break and buy their game, it's dirt cheap and solid gameplay.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game reminds me of a mix of The Long Dark, Rust, And DayZ(just no zombies). Although the graphics may not look as advanced as those titles i just referenced, you get past the fact that they are not that great. Remember this is an alpha. With that being said, alphas are meant to be tested and improved, therefore if you decide to buy this game dont expect everything to work how you would like it yet. I believe that after this game reaches its beta state it will be very successful.

P.S.

When you start playing expect to get killed a lot, and i mean A LOT. The Russians who play this game kill you pretty much no matter what you do, even if you just spawned. Also please dont press the cheater button out of anger, a lot of people are getting banned when they didn't do anything. It makes it hard for the developers to have to handle those cases, so please be considerate. Part of the game is getting killed, and if you dont like it this game isn't for you, otherwise add this title to your Steam Library.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I saw this game and it looked like a game my friend could run since he doesn't have a very good computer so we both bought it and he gets 30-35 fps which is playable for him so this game can run on low end pc's. The game is capped at 60fps from what i see and i don't know if they have plans to change that. This game also has a lot already developed into it like a variety of cars (cough cough dayz cough cough) and a lot of weapons, the problem though is it's really hard to find a gun atm because of people camping the places they spawn in giving them an unfair advantage. The spawns in this game should be different and you should spawn randomly on the map rather than spawning in the same area you died in, this would get rid of spawn killing. I hope if this game gets more popular they will add US Servers because 70% of the time you will find russian people and can't understand them so they KOS. This game feels nice and smooth and whats its worth i think its worth the $6. Devs have stated that they are adding better Anti-Cheat and are adding a new map soon.
Overall i give this game a 7/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is worth the $5 dollars! It's like DayZ but without zombies and is a very playable. If you want to play a DayZ like game, then this is for you. It also runs good on very low end PC's if you do happen to have one.

Pros:
-Runs well on older/lower end PC's
-Very playable
-Crafting is available
-Updates everyday
-Very fun with friends
-Graphics are decent


Cons:
-Low player base
-Everything is still very alpha
-Clunky animations
-No customizable settings other than graphics
-Spectating after death which tells you exactly where other players are and what they have on them
-Many players are Russian (From my experience) and most of them (Not trying to be offensive, yet again from my experience) are very agressive and will KOS.
-Server hopping

I recommend you buy this game nevertheless as it will greatly increase the player base and will encourage the developers to keep working on the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Sorry Devs, I really want to enjoy this game - trust me I do - but I really can't do that until you add a dedicated options/settings menu.

For example: there's no setting allowing me to change my mouse sensitivity, therefore I'm having to do a full arc with my arm just to do a 180° turn. Other things are also prohibiting me from wanting to play this game further such as no option to change the FOV; the sound (it's really annoying when you jump and the character just roars 'HUUUUUUH' at me; also no key binding option.

Honestly Devs these are just the small things I think you need to take a look at, I'm sure I'd have enjoyed the game if I'd played it for longer, I just can't seem to enjoy something when I can't tinker with the settings to make it play how I'd like to play - and I'm sure this applies to many other people too.

I'll revist this game in a few weeks/months to see how it's progressed because I am genuinely looking forward to sinking some hours in to it once a few option features have been added.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After putting some hours into this game, I think I have the authority to say that the game is nowhere near complete.
Let me explain,

The game starts of in an abandoned prison with the protagonist/you waking up with a severe headache with only a lighter and a screwdriver with you. You manage to pick the locks out of the prison and make it to a trainyard where you can find some backpacks and other items on the shelves and a house. You head up over the bridge to find a helicopter and maybe some ammo for a gun in it, all this while being chased by annoying wolves. You make it into an area where the primary building is a school, now you might be thinking 'Oh a school, probably some pencils and notebooks.. WRONG
date: in there you will find the most russian kids you could ever find that are geared with AK-47's
recommended: shotguns and all they do is sit in the rooms and wait for people to come inside and that's when they strike. That is how my day went in this game

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nDamn this is literally the best £3.99 i have ever spent or if you are american it would be $4.99. I thought this would be another one of those crappy dayz copy however when i bought it i couldn't stop playing. The game can be buggy like if you travel to a new zone it can crash your game, there can be graphical bugs, however they rarely happen to me however some people have experienced e.g my friend. I cannot wait to see how the game will be in the future i would give this game a 7/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm going to change my previous reccomendation to a positive one now. I know it's been rough for me and I've posted my share of complaints but, I do feel the devs are working on the issues at hand and are trying their best to fix everything. The feedback they've been getting from everyone has more than likely, been of great help. The posts about glitching, loot finding, placement of this and that and about all the hackers in game. This is being taken care of or, so they say. However, they have mentioned several times that, they know who all is hacking and it will be fixed and to add, all those that are hacking, will be permanantly banned from all, S:PAN servers once the final released is ready.

My most positive impression about the game is, it's definately running smooth. I've not had many games that run as smooth as this one does, even more-so, with an 159ms ping. No matter what server I'm playing on, the game runs great. Nothing concerning issues I've had with it are, per the servers the game is running on. They're up, 24/7 and have never crashed, that I know of? Switching from server to server is not an issue at all. Alt/F4 out, switch server and bingo, you're there.

I'm not sure if this is true wth everyone though and I play it with a 64bit system, not a 32bit system. I also don't know if that has anything to do with it or, not? If I was having any actual connection issues with the game, I'd of quit playing it a long time ago and in my games profile, it would probably show you less than 30mins played.

It's an Old School type of game play configuration and perfect for PC/M & KB players.

Is it worth the $5-6? Yes, even more-so at this stage. The devs have already stated that, everyone playing it now, will get the completed, full version at this price and if not, the rest will have to pay the full price for the game once, it's released.

So, if you got $5 to spare and want to help track down hackers, kill hackers and/or, all these frkn wolves/bears in the game, get it and when the final is ready, prepare to gank or, get ganked.

As an added note: This game is playable on XP for those of you who still use them for lower end games.

.

It's not a bad game and I have over 200 hours into it. I plan to have more.

===============================

Edit: It is not advisable to play this game on XP. A friend got it and it really messed up his system. He was getting very low fps in game and couldn't even create/join a server. He tried changing screen reso and it messed up the system once he left the game. Now, he can't return his screen back to it's normal scale.

If you have a beefed up system with a version of XP then, it may work.

Early Access Review

This game is Extremely well done, it has ups and downs like any other game, but for the short amount of time this game has been up I have thoroughly enjoyed it. I would write an entire speech about this game but a short what they can add in my opinion would be best.
What the developers could add to this game is chests and beds!! You can build a lovly base with nice rooms but there is no point. You can't sleep there and you can't store your items anywhere forcing you to take the bare essentials.
Another thing the developers could add to this game is the ability to transfer your guns into your inventory. If this was implemented the game would be a whole lot better then it already is.
These are just afew things i thought the developers could have added to make this game Better. One last thing, Remove the Esc Key Log. I use the Esc key to exit my inventory with every game and when I do it with this game it goes back to the main menu. Remove that Please it's very frustrating when I do it.
I hope this review was helpful and Thanks for reading!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok, there's a lot of bad opinions from people that haven't really tried to play the game, once you get further in the map, you get more stuff, everything is easier to do, guns aren't rare, don't get fully geared, get a gun with enough ammo and kill someone and take their stuff.

Place I recommend to loot at for  major gear: Factory



Yeah, there's hackers every so on, they spawn ♥♥♥♥ but aimbot/wallhack, I don't think so, the closest thing to wallhack that everyone uses is when their friend dies they spectate others in the area to tell them where you are.

Glitches: One abused glitch is people glitch into the rock on the mountain and shoot people through it and not be seen, sometimes mods disapear off your guns when you die along with your shirt but dupes when you find another shirt of any kind.

75% people you run into are russian, so watch yourself, most are aggressive in my opinion.

Good things in my opinion: Spawns aren't over powered, mechanics are simple and clean (most at least), not many glitches, more development than DayZ Standalone.

Bad things in my opinion: Too many wolves, they get annoying and constantly bite you, agro needs to be lowered, cars are a little too slidey while driving, some glitches that people exploit that get annoying. Fist can't be used. Easy to get stuck.

The game is a little confusing but put time into it.

ALSO MAKE SURE TO PLAY WITH FRIENDS

reviewText:
Early Access Review

( If you are deciding to buy then read this ) First of all get the game if you like russians,big firefights, and mass murder by wolves and tractors. Game is fun, but from my experience it is also posessed by a ghost.  At first the game seems small but there are actually many maps.  Me and my friend were traveling from map to map finding many things, and doing well.  We eventually came to a point were we were scarce of food and water.  We decided to shoot eachother with our guns to end the misery, but we searched around a little more to see if there was hope left.  Btw, we were at a point were we saw no players. We eventually found a crashed plane and we deicde to search it. The dark travel screen came up that you get when you travel from map to map.  Me and my friend were quickly horrified as we enetered the area the plane seemed to turn into  a dark underground vault, where it was very creepy, it was like nothing else in the game.  Me and my friend were confused and scared so we exited the area and reneted.  On the second time we entered we found a man who was not there standingf there before, we shot him.  We exited again and went back in for the third time.  I quickly realised something was wrong as my friend was there a second ago, but now he wasnt.  We talked over skype about what was happeneing.  While i roamed the creepy room all of  a sudden in a blink of an eye i was in another room.  This room was creepy and dark and the floor was filled a ft. high with water.  What made the experience worse was i wasnt  alone in this new room, the same man we shot before was in the room was there too, so i bolted int a big room in the middle and ran into some sort of closet and hid. I then died of freezing to death and lost all my stuff including my gas mask,rifle,shot gun, and all my cool clothes.  While i was waiting to respawn, i saw the water splash next to my dead body, as i respawn i was scared to find my slef spawn in the dark water room again.  I quit scared out of my mind.  My friend died in the other dark room but trace back to his dead body.  i hope this was just a glitch because now im stuck in a dark room forever with a ghost.

10/10 would play crapping myself at 3:00 in the morning simulator again.

All in all the game has its fun moments, but  can the game creators respond and tell me if the water" room is supposed to be there.

Day 1:I manned up and searched the water room.  It is literally the maze of hell.  I am stuck wandering the maze.  Pls send more russians with shotguns for backup.

Day 2: I heard breathing
date: i got paranoid but it was my own...few.\n\nDay 3: I am currently going to keep writing logs until im saved
hoursPlayed:
search for the crashed airline plane and help.

Btw these arent actually days these are really just minutes.

Day 4: I found an elevator! Im saved thank god!  But still

For 5 euro you can't lose. Bought this game with low expectations but enjoy the game very much.

I played some DayZ before but i stopped playing it because the optimisation was terrible.
I honostly rather pay the amount of money i spend on DayZ to this game than to DayZ itself.

The game itself runs smooth, obtaining weapons isnt hard. And most of all no lagging through walls AI.
Bad thing i think is the map. It isnt one big map, but devided in sectors. Maybe thats also a good thing because it saves you a hell load of ping drops.

I'm too lazy to write down all the pros and cons.

Overall this game is good, and for 5 euros you can have  a great time.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Introduction
This is a very interesting game, even though the developers are Russian, I am actually surprised this game is fun. However there is a downside to this game. Everyone who I have come across has CS aim. Don't know what CS aim is? No matter, the following paragraph will explain. After the first paragraph, I will talk about the game and a potential scenario you may find yourself in.

What is CS aim?
CS aim is referred to as Counter Strike aim, yes the game we all know and love. Basically everyone who shoots at you is probably a Global Elite; I say this because every battle I have been involved in always ends up with me being outplayed beyond, literally. I may be sitting in a bush (lots of foliage around me, basically impossible to see me) and people will locate my exact coordinate and fire at me, whenever I move, they will keep shooting without missing. So in conclusion CS aim is just the theory of someone never missing a shot no matter the situation.

The Game
The game overall is actually quite fun, you will find yourself with a gun (eventually) and some ammo, and when you have this almost instantly you will hear footsteps, loud footsteps. Your heart will race and you will try to outsmart whoever this is, but always remember my theory, CS aim. You use your knowledge of the CS aim philosophy, so you camp it out a bit waiting for the person to appear before you, and when they do, you shoot, only to find out you didn't load the gun. The person is now identified as a white male, Russian ex Spetsnaz Praposhchik. The man drops to the ground and lights you up within a heartbeat... Now you wait 59 seconds to respawn.

Conclusion
11/10 would play smart against ex Spetsnaz Praposhchik and forget to load my gun. gg

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For 5.99 you can get a great experiance in a post apocolyptic world. Honestly this game is worth every penny. It could even be put up against DayZ.

One thing I wish I knew before buying this game is that it is Linear. You work your way through a map of multiple areas. Each new area having a different enviornment and different loot. Some areas will be filled with weapons and ammo. While others are filled with Food and Water. Some areas can be unforgiving lacking in food or weapons to defend yourself.

Like any survival game it's always good to have a friend with you. So i'd recommed you grab a buddy and explore this world. Plus for this game being so under priced why not.

In summary this game is worth trying.A great introduction into the survival game genre without dropping a $30 price tag. It's built quite well and I did not run in to any serious glitches.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Now.... I will just talk about it a little bit. I've played this game for a while, on another account, and i'm just here to tell you about the game.
For this game's price, it's one of the best damn games i've seen. They have been working way harder to make their game better. DayZ has been in EA for 2-3 years, and coming out with updates nearly every month. This game has been out for nearly a year now, and it seems to be going on alot better then DayZ. While this game dosen't even compare to survival games like Ark, as I said before, it's price is alot better. The graphics are decent, and it takes very little computing power to actually run, also compared to ARK, which takes a very decent computer to run.
All in all, it's a good game with a good price, what else would you want?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Best $5 ive ever spent, this game is actually better than dayz and H1Z1 at the moment, they have way more guns than dayz, more realistic loot style than dayz and H1Z1 and this game is actually challenging. Ive only found 1 minor bug, sometimes you get stuck and have to log and run or kill your self. They have developed a way of surpression by blurring and making your screen go red which is actually effective. They have created a realistic style of manipulating your weapon and challenge you to mind a magazine and ammo not only ammo. The environment is most hostile i have come across, not rust, dayz or Reign of kings can even compare, almost everyone is out to kill you, mainly russians.

10/10 WOULD CAMP IN A WAREHOUSE WITH A SAIGA AND YELL WOLVERINES" WHILE MOWING DOWN ROUGHLY 12 PEOPLE."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*This is already better than of what RUST or DAYZ standalone has become. Like seriously, those games are dead.


PROS:
+ A lot of action
+ Not grindy
+ Works smoothly on hi graphics with medium pc.
+ Combat is much better than in look-a-likes (rust).
+ Enviroment feels alive
+ Hunger/thirst/temperature are there to create survivalish feeling. Not to annoy you, and not to be ignored forever.
+Lots of loot, alive combat (magazines, rounds, weapon conditions)
+ Very nice post-apocalyptic enviroment.

CONS:
-Full of russians. (the ones that completely ignore the fact that english is worldwide lang).
-Crafting is messy and unclear o.O
-NO DOORS. Again, no doors. Like, you cant have a base YET.
-NPC enemies are buggy for the moment.
-Weapons condition might be changing too frequently.
-Instad of one-open-world there are these 'zones' that you pass. Map is divided into the zones. Loading screen each time u enter a new zone. Annoying as f**k.


Overall: 7/10.
After they add doors ill give this game 8/10. Still needs some polishing, but i'd say i would buy this game for 15$ anyway. AFTER THEY ADD FREAKING DOORS -.-

reviewText:
Early Access Review

- I spawned on some kind of road in the woods.
-Found a building and got a pistol.
-Found a guy in the same building and tried to shoot him but both of us have no ammo.
-Both of us stared at each other for like a minute.
-I ran out of that room, found a Magnum(with ammo), came back and killed that guy.
-Few minutes later heard that there is a guy nearby (footstep sounds)
-Waited for him to enter my Building that i was in.
-He opens a door and kills me instantly with a shotgun.
10/10 There is a Karma in this game.
P.S Note for Devs. iam playing with a low end laptop and i have noticed that rain particles drops fps like no bussines, and dog ragdolls sometimes glitch out (moves weirdly in one place and drop fps by doing that)
Game looks great but it needs some more customizable settings.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Seriously this game has earned 10/10

Oks:
It runs good on low end pcs.
Its cheap! (RIP AK47-Redline)
It has a lot of weapons which are already costumizable.
The game gives feels of it haveing over 1 million clothing.
First time i see that i have to find clips to use the ammo amazing idea.
Perfectly coded item,food,weapon drop system.
Dayz took 2 years to get vehicles, this game needs a month to have that and even more.

Suggestions:
Worktool inventory section. [Line in inventory specified for worktools]
(Cuz right now it sucks to pick 2 mele weapons only cuz u need to work with wood and not be able to have a gun)

Adding Lynx. [Game needs cats too]
(A wild and fast animal with attackstyle of a predator, this cats launch position might be from a tree)

Furniture crafting,baricadeing,window and door creation. [Lets builda a snowman]
(Right now makeing a cabin is pointless adding these things, might make it useful)

Dog folowers. [Just an insane dream probbably not gona happen]
(Dogs could be good folowers in this game, like people could use dogs to trace food or enemies, or if the dog is trained enough it could be used for weapon or amunation searching)

Weapon skin system. [Skins could not be lost]
(I have noticed that people like to play games where they can earn money, this game could have similar system to csgo.It could be optimized like haveing Supply drop cases" which couldb be only opened by  "Supply Keys" which would cost money.That would give you cash to improve the game more and players would earn money by selling skins or lose some money by purchaseing them.)

Waiting for more updates
date: and hopefully waiting for your decision on my ideas."

Early Access Review

This game has tons of Potential, it just needs a ♥♥♥♥ ton of work

The good
-it's not zombie survival game
-Gamemodes?
-intresting worlds

The bad
-if you dont have one of the three melee weapons(or a gun) you can't fight back
-if you don't have an axe you freeze to death
-food, meds and water are insanly difficult to find
-servers don't seem to have tons of people
-does not explain how to make a car work at all... (nothing about gas or finding keys)
-extreamly random spawns (does not make sense to me  seeing how you start in a prison)
-Extreamly unhelpful map
-you can starve to death and or die of dehydration in about an hr (about a day in game)
The ugly
-Those really weird tiedye jeans i found
-the graphics

10/10 would starve some more...

Early Access Review

This is a good $5 game. For the price you will not get a better 1st person survival game.
Graphically, it is not a AAA game and does not compare to the retail DayZ game or even to STALKER games.
But it is well worth the $5 to mess around in until they flesh it out more.
So yes I would easily recommend it to people interested in the genre.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok lets see. I played the game several hours now and the more i play, the less fun it makes. But i will make a pro/ contra list, so see for yourself.

Pro:

-For an Early Alpha Version it works pretty well. Stable ingame, sometimes hanging up upon switching between parts of the map, but all in all pretty smooth
-5 Euro is really cheap, so if you dont like it, you dont waste much money

Thats it for the real pros...

Contra:

Environment:

- Snow everwhere...exept for the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ marsh...else snow, snow, snow
- the same 5 houses, with the exact same inventory everywhere, exept for a school, a church and an industiral complex
- only 2 npc enemies, wolves and bears randomly spawning, even right after start where you just run for your life
- a really bad and small inventory...if you arent lucky to get a bag sometime, you are just running around with 8 slots...gg
- if you pick up a handgun and an axe, you can switch between them...then you pick up an shotgun and can switch between axe and shotgun, but to choose your handgun you have to drop axe or shotgun...and if you want to carry axe and hammer, to build something, you cant carry a big gun to defend yourself..gg
- First half of the game is farming food n weapons in the first 2 villages...farm them, switch server to reset the villages and the loot, farm again.
Then you can either go through an endless pretty empty marsh, swimming through icewater, so make a fire every 5 metre, or get 2 hit killed by a bear.
Or you got lucky and get fuel for an engine in a bunker to use an elevator to get through...what will happen like 1 of 1000 times.

BUT...you will rarely get that far. You waste an hour looting houses, just to get shot by anyone spotting you.
I dont know what kind of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ play this game, but they dont get the survival part...working together or so...nah...kill anything moving, to steal his loot.
You could beg for mercy, but 95% of the players are russians who dont speak english and even if they understand you, they dont give a ♥♥♥♥.

So its just, loot, die, restart at 0....again and again and ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥IT AGAIN.


So better spend 20 Euro more for a better survival game, like the forest.



Update:

Another great job...now they added an prison as starlocation....so you waste 10 minutes running through an empty building with 5000 doors, finding no loot at all...at least nothing useful, like ammo for the imaginary gun you received yet or a portable radio without batteries.

And after you managed to get out there, some russian ret.ards just sit outside waiting for some unarmed guy to show up, just to instantly kill you.

Good Job, now the game is completly unplayable, since you always! (yes i tried it on 13 servers now, everytime, killed after prison) die by those no life inc.est bas.♥♥♥♥♥.

I want my money back! Now!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's better than most of the games out there for $5, but it's still not worth it.

The keyboard controls cannot be changed. They are what they are. This is what I hated the most. Also if you have an axe, hammer, or whatever you can't use your pistol unless you drop it. You can only switch between your primary and melee weapon if you have a melee weapon. If you have no melee weapon you are free to use primary and secondary weapons, but for whatever reason melee weapon takes over for your secondary weapon.

Other players are lagging all over the place which makes it very hard to kill hostile players warping all over around me... I've killed 2 players in 2 hours. Could have killed a 3rd... Shot him in the face twice with a shotgun then I think he quit. All you have to do is hit ESC to exit a server instantly. Easy to combat dodge and Server hop for loot. The only thing that takes a minute is respawning after a death which makes you wait 1 minute. So I can combat dodge and server hop easily for loot but I can't respawn instantly. Makes so much sense! Also I can see where all the other players are on the server while I'm dead! GHOSTING ANYONE!? Anyway...

I've only been killed by wolves or freezing to death... The community can't seem to aim or I'm just as laggy for them as they are for me. So back to freezing. You need an axe to get the wood, lighter fluid to put on the wood, and a lighter. Most lighters have 6% fluid in them that I have found and that is not enough to light the wood. I will usually have wood and lighter fluid and no lighter or i have a lighter and lighter fluid and can't find an axe and I freeze to death.

The community is lame and annoying in VOIP... You can look at bushes with your crosshair to see if a person's name shows up so you know if someone is trying to hide where you can't see.

I like the inventory system. All items take up 1 slot, you start out with 8 and a backpack only adds another 8 slots for a total of 16 slots. Meds are really hard to find and you can't combine anything together except for ammo. So I will have a lighter, lighter fluid, wood, 2 cans of food, can opener, 2 or 3 bottles of water, primary and secondary ammo, all the meds i can find, and still have room for more. You can't put weapons in your backpack for a buddy like in DayZ, but whatever...

There is a map but no compass in game, but the map shows your general location. It's a small location compared to other survival games.

Overall the game is just alright. I don't understand this mostly positive score. These people must have only played games in the 90s because this game has about that level of detail. The gameplay feels more modern but needs a lot more work. I've never played Rust, but I'm going to go ahead and recommend a game I've never played for an extra $15 cause this is the internet you all do whatever someone tells you to do on the internet.

RESPECT MAH AUTHORITEH AND BUY RUST CAUSE I SAID TO!!!

Or you can just save your $5 for the next big thing... It's up to you. It's your money and you are in control.

Early Access Review

This game is very intresting... I will start with some pros and list some cons. Please be aware this is a brief review and doesn't go over the whole game.

Pros:
-Pretty cheap being 5 dollars, good price for it atm.
-OK variety of weapons
-People don't always Kill on Sight (Of course this might change if this game becomes more popular)
-Not a usual apocalypse" survival game
date: instead of zombies or mutants it has real animals such as bears and wolves.\n-You can go into most buildings\n-Food
voteText:
runs somewhat sturdy except at times you can freeze to death quite easy without gasoline or an axe.

Cons:
-The map is extremely confusing
-There are different "sections" of the entire map
-Bears are OP and can usually one hit you
-Most clothing does not provide any buffs and doesn't help warmth but is just for looks.
-There are only around 2-3 types of rifle weapons atm

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My review for this game:

Pros:
+Price
+Lot of players
+Easy to learn map
+Sectors(locations)
+Loot system is good everybody can have loot its not like you go in and its clear.
+Lot of guns and ammo types
+Interesting looting you need to open door with e" key and than you can grab your loot
+Vehicles also but we need little bit more of them.
+Anti-cheat

Cons:
- Bad in-game settings (no settings)
- Need settings for sensisivity
- Inventory split ammo (you can stack your ammo but cant split)
- Inventory for parts of your clothing.(no clothing inventory)
- Chat(no chat ingame)(only voicechat.)
- Hitboxes for dogs are very bad.
- Starting with hands and you cant use them for selfdefense.(we need fist fighting :D)
- No explosives(i dont know if they are some but i dont find any grenades)
- ESC KEY >:(

My idea: let us switch between pistol and maingun without throwing it out
date: its useless have pistol if i must drop maingun on the floor and than grab it back.\n\nGame is good but it need more fixing and settings i think it have future but devs must work on it."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I got yelled at for my previous review, stating that I was too harsh for an early access game

For five dollars it isn't too bad, it certainly needs polishing and fixes. However, I did notice that the game itself is frequently updated so I wouldn't consider them to be Bohemia developers. The name is admittingly cheesy, however Survival" really does fit in with the game well as there are no zombies or infected beings. Instead you get a cold
date: rough winter that you have to force yourself to survive in. You get that threat along with the threat over other players in need of gear to live themselves. The concept has been used many times of course
recommended: however the game does have potential over all. If the game were to serious up a bit and focus more on the effects of the cold
voteText: and the threat of death in the mountains
helpfulPercent: I wouldn't find it that bad. However
votesHelpful: this idea has been already taken by Garry Newman's Rust which is a survival game as well that is ALSO in the stages of heavy development. What I see currently is a shell of what this company intends to make. In all honesty I don't know if this game intends to be a quick way to make a buck or a serious attempt at making a serious survival game in the cold. All of the settings seem correct.\n\nThe reason I have changed my support on this game is because I see that it does have a chance of surviving
votesTotal: and if you go and buy it for five quid or dollars
votesFunny: then you are simplying supporting the game itself and maybe that will give it the chance to grow and continue to dev.\n\nThere are plenty of issues obviously
commentsCount: but why not try it out and have an attempt at it."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Played the facebook version for more than 500hours got tired of the hackers.
Me and my friend decided to buy the game .
After 10hours of gameplay totally not worth 5 bux.
The graphics and sound are pretty good and the ideas and concept are too and this game has a lot of potential.
But right now its not Worth it.

Pros
-The graphics and sound are pretty good
-Lovely community:There's no community

Cons
-the game isnt getting updated.
-there's too much bugs, my friend died for no reason
-it's too hard to find a car
-it's so freaking hardcore, you have to eat so much and drink, wounded becuase of a 1 metre drop.
-there's dogs everywhere, and only dogs thers no other animals
-There's alot of hackers
-The Servers are empty
-You cant find anything besides batterys, food sometimes and weapon cleaning kits that dont even work
-the Map is too big for 40 players, the servers usually dont reach 20 players theres less than 50 players playing
-The military base is huge as hell and you can't find anything in it
-Zones.The map ahs a lot a zones, one is the Bunker, i get out of the car and my friend too we enter inside the bunker wich is a different Zone, waste one gas can only find a juice.Leaves the Bunker and teh car desappeared
-the loot: The loot is completely Stupid i can see one chocolate bar but my friend sees a juice or my friend sees a shotgun and i see an axe.
-Base Building:too easy to build houses, people build things everywhere and block ♥♥♥♥.There isnt even doors or storages
-temperature:max temp is 36º, your tem drops very quicly, its very hard to make campfires clothing doesnt make any difference.
-Weapon Slots:Theres 3 weapon slots, too big ones for rifles or melles and one for a pistol, if you had your too big ones with weapons like a rifle and an axe you cant select your pistol.
-there's only Russians




So right now i dont think you should buy the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Please know that I didn't buy this game. I got it in a giveaway.

I'm going to give my First Impressions of this game, if you just want to get a quick glance at what this game offers, skip the first Impression bit, and check out the Pros and Cons.

First Impressions I begin in a lit prison cell, i immedietly grab a screw driver and a lighter laying in the cell. I quickly pick the lock, and walk out of the cell, into an almost pitch-black prison... Which had me frightened... Would another character be sneaking about to get a few fresh spawn kills? Well no. I ended up just waltzing about in the dark for ten minutes until I grew tired and looked up what I needed to do. Ah, the torch in the prison cell can be picked up...
Now since I have a light source, I quickly pick a lock, and jump into a sewer. As I waltz about in there, suddenly lightning flashes, and it begins to rain...
In a Sewer, under the Prison...
I soon manage to find a hole, leading to a loading screen... Taking me out finally into (What I thought hopefully) was the open-world. I waltz'd about for a little while around a trainyard, till I found a backpack. I left and followed a road... Which after five minutes of walking, took me to a loading screen. It was at this point I said ♥♥♥♥! Don't tell me this game has area loading screens! I found myself at what would appear to be a dinky little military outpost. As I would past it, I suddenly am flashed with another loading screen, as I then suddenly load back ALL THE WAY BACK THE TRAINYARD, WHERE I SPAWNED!?!? *sighs*
My character starts to complain about being hungry and thirsty... Nonstop. Then he starts complaining about 27.3 C Temperature to be really chilly... WHAT!? Maybe 27.3 F... But 27.3 C is a bit... Warm.
I FINALLY come across something, a bear. I swing at it a f- Dead.
W-What!? No!? NO! I have to do that stupid prison opening again!?
*Flash forward...* Climbing up a mount- Wtf!? I just TELEPORTED BACK AT THE TRAINYARD AGAIN!? WTF!?!?
*A little while later* How do I eat? How do I drink!? I am clicking left and right, spamming the E button... SPAMMING ALL THE KEYS TO JUST FIGURE OUT HOW TO EAT AND DRINK!!!
THIS was where I considered to stop playing.
I mean... This game is broken. BROKEN. Empty as well. less then 60+ players total, and only 10 being on the most populated server. (Perhaps it would be best to remove a couple servers, and only have like 1 or 2 for the current population as of now.)

Pros -Devs just got back to working on this game! Will change the review as development takes shape.
-Vehicles, including Cars and Helicopters... Apparently. I never did find any.
-The Graphics aren't that bad, and the game runs pretty smoothly.
Cons -Broken... Just UTTERLY BROKEN. Ex. Spawning back in for me gave me double of all my items...
-Inv. right now is a mess. (Update) The issues with eating and drinking was a glitch which didn't let me access any of my food or items.
-No Character Creation
-Voiced Acted Character... No, I think the characters shouldn't be voice acted. Just let the players do all the talking.
(Seriously, the character just whines and moans non-stop.)
-Very LOW playerbase.
-More a recommendation, perhaps have an option to disable having to go through the long and dull process of the Prison.

Conclusion? Survival :Postapocalypse Now is a very EARLY Early Access Game, on the lines of development so far. This is one of those times I wish steam had a So-so option to recommend. The devs show great potential, but right now the game is an utter mess. I'll come check it out again after a couple updates and PRAY it improves. :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

暂时玩了半小时，发现画面竟然能媲美DAYZ和H1Z1，甚至某些方面比这两个万年（将来）A测的游戏还好。
首先优化好，配置平民，服务器质量高，最重要的是游戏只需5刀！！！
实际上，系统和游戏内容都已经超过这5刀的价格了。有建造系统，Loot木系统，还有必备的PVP系统，武器很丰富，载具也没的说，那剩下还有什么能说的呢……
不过跟DAYZ和H1Z1来比的话，这个游戏更倾向于生存而不是打丧尸，因为丧尸真的很少很少!
最后，为作者的更新速度点个赞。

Early Access Review

WTH is going on here? That bear sounded like it was tearing through dimensions. Still better than H1Z1 at launch. Is it worth $5? Im still not sure. But Im going to keep playing it and say yes for now. Kind of. As long as you dont mind that nothing works and if there is one person on a server they have all of the weapons, can find you very fast, and just KOS you.

Seriously, even in Early Access you need to be able to use the items taht you find. Out of all of the spawns Ive played now only one actually allowed me to select an item in my inventory. Allof the other times it was stuck on the same slot. So I couldnt select the food or water that I found to remedy my condition.

Player who kept killing me was actually facing the wrong way when he shot and killed me (180 degrees the wrong way) and he was able to float across the whole map. Seems legit.

Ive played worse Early Access games but not many this bad. But its under $5. You dont even get a shirt for that. Im serious. You dont get a shirt.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm a seasoned rust player, I own and have played Dayz (though I find that death in Dayz to be crushing). And I'm a huge fan of the S.t.a.l.k.e.r. series. So, I pick up this game thinking it's at least worth a go.

1. Nothing like rust, got it. Building is shallow and for the most point useless. (no buildable storage to be found, no reason to stay in one place)

2. Dayz built in a game engine built for a game like Dayz.  A military sim turned zombie survival is a great idea, but its clunky and never felt right. Unity Is pretty much built for it. Survival:pn is smooth and feels good when your playing it. But Dayz got the survival right, the scavenging felt right, the wandering felt right. Survival:pn did it better, without zombies.

3. S.t.a.l.k.e.r. feel. Everything feels dark and dirty. Even on a sunny day the game makes you feel depressed (in a good way?) Its not cartoon-ish like fallout, it feels like 50 years after the world stopped spinning like it should.

All in all, Its worth the $5.

Words for the devs:
I've died two times by getting stuck (requiring suicide) for every one time i've died otherwise. For $5 I don't expect you to fix every little thing. But maybe a way to unstuck" yourself?

Mutants please
date:
I break the sound barrier when i fall 10 feet.

Obama was an inside job

I like squirrels

"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hello,


The Full Controller Support that was implemented into the game doesn't work and hopefully will be fixed soon, because I like many like to play games in a more relaxed state generally, and keyboard and mouse just doesnt work anymore, unless you are a programmer or super-GEEK! The thermal update to use clothes as well as other items is a BIG+ as in to not have to worry about dying so quickly searching for the other rare items to find that would help you with thermal protection. HEALTH !, as in there needs to be a way or more items in areas to keep you from dying from lack of good health including lowering the amount of dogs in an area would greatly help.  Ammo needs to be close by that actually works with the gun and descent amount when you pick up a gun, gas container for vehicles of all types as well as generators or machinery needs to be in more areas, and the constant putting you in the swamp when you are more then two areas ahead of it, needs to be fixed as in not fair to always spawn that far back from where you died, as well as a driveable boat or two needs to be put in the swamp, pre-fabricated traps (e.g. bear trap) and the ability to make a trap (e.g. nature tarp with spiked pit below) needs to be added into the game. Last but not least for now scuba diving gear for fun and finding items under water would be a nice new added feature. In closing thanks for listening to your customers and future customers of this great potential game that I believe will be the best survival and then some type of game in a long time when it's finally completed or completed enough for a final release that I'm sure will have updates even then ;)

this is a good game with loads of potential and for £4 i actually enjoy it its a decent alternative to dayz you cant really complain but sadly theres a few problems

1)this game is rife with hackers, on july 10th 2015 there was two i encountered in the school they were spawning gear in and teleporting around and generally being ♥♥♥♥♥, i had nothing on me except jeans a bad sterotypical haircut and a fireaxe
i hit the first guy around 25 times with the axe which ususally kills armored people after about 6 max he just ignored me and ran away like i wasnt even there, the other guy logged leaving massive amounts of gear his friend took the rest and teleported out. 10/10

2)the game is very sterotypical with the player clothing and haircuts, they look ridiculous and the russian players are going to eventually drive down the player base with the hacking and abusive behaviour towards other players

to be honest im hoping the devs read some of the comments on steam left by people and make some improvements because they have something good here and it would be a shame to let it fall to waste, i would happily pay an extra £10 on the £4 i already paid if it meant improvements and an anti cheat system

more weapons would be nice, a better weapon/items spawn time would be nice also and something to help with explaning  crafting and using items while ingame.
because the average player would get lost or stuck on what to do or how to use things together

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros:

* Better looting than Stalker, Fallout 3. You really go through a lot of stuff. Looting is really fun in this game.

*Graphics are moderate so people with older computers should have no problem playing this game.

*Networking seems really solid. Server had 40 people on it and no problems from me.

Cons :

*Start out in a Prison, which turns out is a tutorial level. There are no real instructions, but you must escape out the basement thru an underground river. THEN you will finally connect to a server.

* Modelers need to go over the map. Everything needs to be scaled.   2 lane roads are only as big as a sidewalk. Locomotives are the size of a small pickup truck. You need to jump to get up some stair cases... All minor, but annoying things common in all Alpha games.

Totally worth the $6 i payed... Cant wait to see this game when it leaves Alpha.

Early Access Review

This game is amazing. Amazing. I can't believe how good this game is for five dollars. FIVE DOLLARS! This Survival: postapocalypse Now is by far the best game i've ever played for under 20$. Overall I think it is underpriced, and you know a game's good when you play it for almost 5 hours from when you download it and have to go to sleep! :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

WTH is going on here? That bear sounded like it was tearing through dimensions. Still better than H1Z1 at launch. Is it worth $5? Im still not sure. But Im going to keep playing it and say yes for now. Kind of. As long as you dont mind that nothing works and if there is one person on a server they have all of the weapons, can find you very fast, and just KOS you.

Seriously, even in Early Access you need to be able to use the items taht you find. Out of all of the spawns Ive played now only one actually allowed me to select an item in my inventory. Allof the other times it was stuck on the same slot. So I couldnt select the food or water that I found to remedy my condition.

Player who kept killing me was actually facing the wrong way when he shot and killed me (180 degrees the wrong way) and he was able to float across the whole map. Seems legit.

Ive played worse Early Access games but not many this bad. But its under $5. You dont even get a shirt for that. Im serious. You dont get a shirt.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

SURVIVAL: POSTAPOCALYPSE NOW DIARY

Got in the game, found a dog, got killed because I was too much of a pansy to use my fists.

Respawned, found some guy looting the building, said hi, didn't respond, I got shot in the back by some other guy.

Several hours later, I've finally got some good gear. I've got my backpack, clothes, shotgun, plenty of ammo and an axe. I was looting a church-like place when I saw a guy in there. Told him to keep calm and that I had no intention of shooting him. He looked at me, stepped closer, bashed me in the face with a hammer. I blew his brain to bits. I bled for about 20-25 minutes, going through town to town while looking for some medicine. After 6 diffrent towns, I came up with nothing. Spent my last five minutes jacking off into the mostly abandoned lands of Siberia.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At £4.99 this game is what you should expect for such a low price tag. They say the objective is to survive, but it's nothing more than a fairly small deathmatch arena, spread across a few small, lightly populated zones, each as bleak and barren as the next.

You spawn in, you try and find guns and ammo raking through draw after draw and cupboard after cupboard, if you don't get ganked doing that then it's time for you to go do the ganking until your ammo runs out or you die, then repeat.

I'm not sure what I was expecting, not alot because it's so cheap, but it's not my cup of tea, as they say! Theres no purpose, just a really old looking fps with very very light survival aspects, including a hunger meter that goes down ridiculously quickly and a building system with zero purpose at all.

Not recommended, it's not bad, it's just not worth anybody's time lol.

amazing game, if you are into dayZ and dont have the money this is the game for you. with simple controlls and a beautiful map what more could you want. GUNS, CARS, HELICOPTERS, BASE BUILDING, WHAT MORE DO YOU NEED IN A SERVIVAL GAME.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

WE  NEED MANY PLAYERS   TO KILL AND HAVING FUN!!!!  ( If you are deciding to buy then read this ) First of all get the game if you like russians,big firefights, and mass murder by wolves and tractors. Game is fun, but from my experience it is also posessed by a ghost. At first the game seems small but there are actually many maps. Me and my friend were traveling from map to map finding many things, and doing well. We eventually came to a point were we were scarce of food and water. We decided to shoot eachother with our guns to end the misery, but we searched around a little more to see if there was hope left. Btw, we were at a point were we saw no players. We eventually found a crashed plane and we deicde to search it. The dark travel screen came up that you get when you travel from map to map. Me and my friend were quickly horrified as we enetered the area the plane seemed to turn into a dark underground vault, where it was very creepy, it was like nothing else in the game. Me and my friend were confused and scared so we exited the area and reneted. On the second time we entered we found a man who was not there standingf there before, we shot him. We exited again and went back in for the third time. I quickly realised something was wrong as my friend was there a second ago, but now he wasnt. We talked over skype about what was happeneing. While i roamed the creepy room all of a sudden in a blink of an eye i was in another room. This room was creepy and dark and the floor was filled a ft. high with water. What made the experience worse was i wasnt alone in this new room, the same man we shot before was in the room was there too, so i bolted int a big room in the middle and ran into some sort of closet and hid. I then died of freezing to death and lost all my stuff including my gas mask,rifle,shot gun, and all my cool clothes. While i was waiting to respawn, i saw the water splash next to my dead body, as i respawn i was scared to find my slef spawn in the dark water room again. I quit scared out of my mind. My friend died in the other dark room but trace back to his dead body. i hope this was just a glitch because now im stuck in a dark room forever with a ghost.

10/10 would play crapping myself at 3:00 in the morning simulator again.

All in all the game has its fun moments, but can the game creators respond and tell me if the water" room is supposed to be there.

Day 1:I manned up and searched the water room. It is literally the maze of hell. I am stuck wandering the maze. Pls send more russians with shotguns for backup.

Day 2: I heard breathing
date: i got paranoid but it was my own...few.\n\nDay 3: I am currently going to keep writing logs until im saved
hoursPlayed:
search for the crashed airline plane and help.

Btw these arent actually days these are really just minutes.

Day 4: I found an elevator! Im saved thank god! But still

**Things i love about the game**


1.The game to be is basically DayZ, but with no thirdperson and the price is a MAJOR price downage.

2.I may run the game with 30 fps but i can tell you, the gameplay is nice and smooth and easy to control.

3.Sprinting does not run out quicky!

4. Raining, Snowing, Night, Day, This is like a example of real life!

5.Random spawning? Great for finding new things!


**Things i don't like about the game**

1. Finding people is very rare to me in this game

2. Wolfs and Bears are to op

3. Critical Damage from falling off a little leadge?

4. I think finding stuff in this game is a little to hard, thirst and cookies are quick to find but guns and ammunition are rare.

5.Backpack space should could a little more thing just 2 more added layers........

6.Ladders and stairs could actually should have a animation for both of them.





But in conclusion i really LOVE this game, just a few simple mistakes in there. Plus the game is in beta to it's not fully finished. Overall, i learn from my mistakes in this game. That's why now i a auto machine gun and some good gear.





9/10   Just like DayZ






P.S. The price of this game should be higher like 10 or 14.99

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has a lot of potential. But needs a lot of work and love. But I think it's worth the money, because it's a fun game. Yes it has some drawback,but don't forget, it's an alpha version. Recomended for all fans of postapocalyptic survival genre.
For newcomers it can be hard,especially solo players, because of other players who hunt you,but be honest guys,in real postapocalyptic life,people are merciles :) Who whatched Revolution or The walking dead, 12 monkeys  series will understand :)
The are couple problems and issues with this game,but I think developers will add them in the nearest future:
-would be nice to see nicknames,add to friendlist on steam when meet somebody
-give a handicap to new players or separate experienced from them who have a decent inventory(guns with bullets in particular)
-add a tab,where you can see all the players in server and show stats ( for example how much hours in real time player stayed alive)
Despite that,I recommend playing this with a friend or friends, it's hilarious :)
