reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm not going to lie to you: This is a difficult game. It's certainly harder than DayZ and unturned.  But if you've played those games your knowlage should translate.  Here's what makes this game stand out:

You can die from so much more: In DayZ and Unturned, hunger  and players are your arch nemesis.  In this game you have hunger, cold, bears, wolfs, thirst, clothes, and even people that don't speak your language WILL kill you on sight.

This game is a harder DayZ with far fewer glitches (and a more bareable price tag).  So lets get down to my expiriences that will help you new players:

This game is NOT friendly to new players, but at least you can get a hang of the controls.  The most helpful one is Z, if you can tell the people around you not to kill you then that's a perk.  Now, don't expect to run around for five minutes and find everything you need to survive.  It might've been that way in the prison but if you die you DO NOT return to the prison.  So if you have some high hopes of it being easy if you die you should head on over to DayZ or Unturned.

Next: If you don't want to be friends with someone you have an option: Kill them on the spot or rob them.  I prefer option two because it may save ammo.  Better yet: all guns you find won't have ammo, so if you simply point an unloaded gun at someone and threaten to shoot, they might never know.  Remember: once the robbery ends do not stick around. He might have friends.  If you feel like he didn't give you everything and you do have ammo: shoot him in the head.


Next are animals: You have two threats in animals, they are wolfs and bears.  I've never seen a bear outside of the marshes so you shouldn't have too much panic.  The wolves are a different story, they are everywhere.  Good news is they're easy to kill, 2 axe swings or one shot will end them.  This doesn't mean they aren't dangerous however.

Bears on the other hand I've only had one run in with, I can't say I liked it.  It jumped out at me in the marsh and scared the living ♥♥♥♥ out of me.  DO NOT FIGHT A BEAR.

Next is food:  Food is a necessity, and so is water.  Find them and charish them.  Some food will require a can opener so be on the lookout for them.

Cloths are vital.  If nothing previously listed kills you, this will.  Unlike Unturned or DayZ, you aren't in a habitable inviornment.  The enviornment of this game is norther Siberia.  If you aren't dressed right you will not survive.  You spawn in a pair of weird jeans (which I'm pretty sure have a swastica on the right leg) and some ♥♥♥♥ sneakers.  If you find a shirt put that ♥♥♥♥ on, you WILL freeze.

Players: TRUST NOBODY!  If you have friends, trust them but not too much.  They CAN and WILL turn on you eventually.


TO THE DEVS:

This is an amazing game but it needs some work:  I'd recommend slowing down the rate that you freeze to death and making more weapons.  Better yet: Let us be able to punch.

Hope this helps you new players

EDIT:  You're going to want some music, I recommend anything by A7X if you like rock, Sabaton if you like metal, D12 Eminem Tupac or Kanye West if you like rap, Fallout boy if you like pop.

EDIT 2:  I've since noticed that there aren't a lot of trolls, but when you find one they are very clever.  Always carry an axe with you so that someone doesn't block your exit with a massive wood wall.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a good example of early access creating a positive dialect between players and devs.

The game has gone under many changes since debuting, many driven by player requests (within reason so far).

The actual game experience can be punishing, but for good reason. Lots of tedious and time consuming looting, typically only to then get blindsided by a stacked freak, or a group of them. The other side of that coin is that kills are meaningful and massive adrenaline dumps. It's actually a refreshing take on the value of a single life - while most games downplay the significance of a single life and create callused gamers.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI saw someone playing this game, and after a short while became interested in purchasing it. For the price, it's worth trying it out, even on a lower end PC, which is amazing. This is a survival game where you find items, combine them, and (if you're smart) survive the harsh elements while dealing with people who will either help you, or kill you where you stand. It can be a bit tough at first, but once you get to know what to do, you'll become cautious and acquire items to survive! As long as the minor issues are patched, and some different things (items, inventory layout etc.) are implemented, this can become a great release for the price! Keep up with the discussions, provide your feedback on issues, and hopefully the devs can help us out! I will definitely come back to this game and play it, and am excited to see what new features will come of this great little survival map in the near future! Trust me, it's bigger than it looks! ;)
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Absolutely worth $5.
Melee combat has a lot to improve, but guns feel pretty solid and they're not as rare.
The game world is big, it has lots of buildings as well as open space to set camp or even build a home, but has some loading screens inbetween areas (I think it's because apparently this game was on facebook first), which I'm hoping will go away as development progresses.
There's a decent amount of loot, and different kinds of food and clothing, but some essentials are somewhat scarce.
The graphics are good looking, movement and performance is smooth, and the system requirements are pretty damn low.
The game world feels a bit empty in terms of ambiance, there should be more road signs and destroyed cars and rubble on the roads, but it's alright since the game is still on alpha and I imagine the devs are focusing more on gameplay and loot/content.

Playing with friends is the best way to play. But surprisingly, there are many friendly players, so even if you're playing solo you might end up in a group. Don't worry though, there's also a lot of hostile, lone wolf kind of players and raiding groups, so sooner rather than later you'll come across some crazy guy that'll try to KOS (which, IMO, adds to the fun). Playing with friends and facing another group of players is interesting and fun, sometimes they'll trade and offer their help, or simply shoot you out of fear. I highly recommend getting this game, really cheap and fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I would recommend this game to anyone looking to play a true survival type game. the one screaming pet peeve would be the true inability to save your character. if you log out you will loose everything. also the fact that you can basically never make a fire to cook any meat makes it impossible to not die of exposure. if those two things would be correct it would be amazing. another really helpful thing would to have a guide book describing the items needed for special tasks like fire making, crafting items, ect.

On the bright side the fact that i have never been booted, lagged out, or run into any glitches on a game this new is astounding. it shows amazing potential and the fluid aiming for weapons combined with the great movement controls allow for perfect reaction to whatever you come across.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First thing I would like to say is that I love this game. I love the concept, I love the variety of weapons and items at the momen. For an early access game it has quite a lot of potential.

Pros:

Huge variety of weapons

Quite a big world

Nice calming/misleadingly calm scenery

Good for lower spec computers (for now)

Fitting music

Very nice price at £4.79


Cons:

For some reason dogs can walk through walls or no-clip through walls which can get annoying

Dogs stop moving but keep on animating, as if they were attacking you or someone if you're not on the same level as them

The edge of the world is a clear invisible wall instead of a mountain or buildings.

Floating object such as trees and buildings. (which is a common glitch with this sort of game in this state so I understand why those sort of graphical glitches in a survival game such as this)

No climbing animation so if you look at someone climbing a ladder they'll just slide up/down the ladder.

Can't find supplies most of the time resulting in starvation, dehydration or freezing to death.

The tutorial ain't easy to follow.


Things I would like to see in this game:

A single player mode so you don't have to worry about being killed by some random person.

A more detailed main menu.

The ability to change FOV (field of view) and mouse sensitivity.

A sort of creative mode or sandbox mode so you can test out equipment or vehicles.


But overall I really enjoy playing this game and I think it has a lot of potential.

I would rate this game 7/10 for the moment, but to be fair this game is too early in production to judge at the moment.


P.S I know I have only played around 2 hours of this, but I wanted to make a review because I disagree with all the people who don't recommend this game because of a few errors/glitches.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I wanted to like this game I really did...but the map size is really the killer for me. I assumed this would be an open world game where your choice to go from one loot location to another could be a death sentance if you didn't have enough supplies to make the trip....you know survival? Unfortunantly this is a series of very very small maps that you zone between and you can just camp one to two loot spots and just server hop for anything you need.

Another thing I felt they did very poorly was the fact the game tries to be death matchy" by showing you the location of other players while you are dead. My problem with this is that it is easly exploitable and honestly if you are dead you should need to build back up before you just go rushing out nude trying to find the guy you saw on the death cam...who may have had nothing at all to do with your death.

The loot system needs a little work. Guns are never in your bags only equiped and if you have a pistol/rifle picking up a melee means you don't have the pistol untill you drop one of the other two. I see the realistic aspect of this
date:
but in a game with death cams we aren't really going for realism here we want pvp action this feature isn't condusive to pvp. Also the survival aspect in relation to loot isn't that great either none of the status bars are hard to manage but the items required to manage those bars take up quite a bit of space in your bags. Not a huge problem considering guns don't go into your bag. I just feel if we are playing a game lets have fun and loot cool ♥♥♥♥ to play with not be forced to make choices about what to drop when I am full loot and my bag consists of very few items most of which require interaction with another item....gun + ammo ect...


I do however like the combat system guns feel accurate and powerful
recommended: but I feel like the community was a bunch of kids that couldn't pvp in more popular survival games so they were looking to be a larger fish in a smaller pond
hoursPlayed: or they are guys that want to "team up and steal my loots" I mean be friends? because this is a base building team game not a death match survival game...lol   I hope this post helps both the devs and the people looking to buy this game as I would like it to improve to the point of recommending it to others."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pretty good game. Has some bugs and optimization issues, but it's got potential.

The good:
-Lots of different guns to find
-Working vehicles (suck it, dayZ)
-Crafting
-Only five bucks
-Loot isn't too hard or too easy to find. You can actually die of dehydration, freezing, and hunger without being just some complete noob
-Unique winter setting

The bad:
-Many bugs, including a black screen bug (never go to the Marsh. they may fix this, but I haven't found out if they did yet)
-Lots of KoS
-When your character starts to freeze, get dehydrated or hungry, etc, he becomes very annoying with his complaining

I'll give this game a 7/10. I haven't played with friends yet, but I imagine that'd make it about an 8/10 for me.

Fresh spawn: Ran around for a bit, enjoying the scenery, found no players.
Came across a couple guys next to a fence with their backs to me.
I watch them, and see Guy 1 shoot Guy 2 in the back; I take off up the mountain.
I find a complex and two guys start shooting at me and another guy. We run like hell.
I named my new friend Gary. Gary doesn't speak much, but Gary is my friend. I love Gary.
We avoid wolves and dodge a couple other players.
I look to see Gary pulled out a fire axe and chopped me to bits.

11/10 No hard feelings, Gary.

I also climbed a ladder with no problems. Worth more than DayZ as is.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nits a very developed game for the early alpha phase and, even though it is more developed than dayz, there are things to be worked on. dayz has a lot of thought put into so before you start judging dayz for being further behind just know that there are things that dayz elaborates on that this game doesn't. first off you cant bleed to death in this game and in dayz you can. survival post apocalypse now has way more vehicles than the standalone, however the standalone has put more work into their vehicles. lastly dayz has a sickness meter and a much larger map with dynamic item spawns (the helicopter crash sites dont always spawn in the same place and guns and items dont always spawn in the same area ). Also dayz in my opinion has less hackers and a better way of dealing with them than survival post apocalypse now. I recommend both dayz and survival post apocalypse now. If you want a ultra realistic zombie apocalypse, go with dayz, if you want a survival game that is easy than dayz but still challenging go with survival post apocalypse now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

No survival game has been able to really hook me.

I don't play this game much anymore either, from time to time I may hop on to play a life, but that's it.
Yet, I have to say the snowy setting, not found in many other games, gives such a great atmosphere.

The fact that you don't see others that often, it's just you, the sound of snow crunching under your feet, and your breathing, it's fantastic. Really gives a feel of isolation and hopelessness as you scavenge for supplies. And when you do encounter someone, it gets tense as f#&k.

I absolutely loved it.

I didn't mind spending my 6 euros.

[People say that the game's abandoned, but the devs said in response, that yes, it was abandoned, but now they're back to it, and will finish the game. I don't know how to react to this.]

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pretty good game. Has some bugs and optimization issues, but it's got potential.

The good:
-Lots of different guns to find
-Working vehicles (suck it, dayZ)
-Crafting
-Only five bucks
-Loot isn't too hard or too easy to find. You can actually die of dehydration, freezing, and hunger without being just some complete noob
-Unique winter setting

The bad:
-Many bugs, including a black screen bug (never go to the Marsh. they may fix this, but I haven't found out if they did yet)
-Lots of KoS
-When your character starts to freeze, get dehydrated or hungry, etc, he becomes very annoying with his complaining

I'll give this game a 7/10. I haven't played with friends yet, but I imagine that'd make it about an 8/10 for me.
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First off I would like to say that currently this game is not worth buying, not yet anyway.
It does have promise for the future, the basics for the game are there but they're buried so deep under a mountain of bugs the devs are going to have to work their arses off to get it right.

I have played the game for about 45 minutes and encountered several bugs, one of which is gamebreaking. Whenever I picked up a new item, my inventory would cease to work, along with the escape menu. The only way to fix it was to alt f4 out of the game and relaunch, which was fine until i needed to pick up another item.

The other bugs aren't really gamebreaking but are really annoying and frustrating. For example, every 10 minutes or so the screen would go black and I would reappear at the edge of the area I was in, leaving me to run through wilderness and eventually die via wolf.

There are more bugs but I don't want to make this review too long.

GOOD POINTS
Looks nice
Runs half decently

Thats about it.

I will be editing this review after I play more of the game after some updates.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I couldn't, in all good conscience, recommend a game in 2015 without custom controls that doesn't want to make itself playable for all audiences. That said, if they ever fixed that, this low-cost survival game has all the janky entertainment of its crafting, bean-eating peers, but without the immense waiting time or giant price tag. A pretty condensed, slightly melancholic work-in-progress.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbla2YVkdNQ

Also, killer fashion statements!
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has many, many issues.

Firstly, it's impossible to create your own server since the patch, meaning you are duty bound to play on a server full of annoying kids from faraway countries who just kill you instantly. Secondly, it's full, and I mean FULL of glitches whereby you get stuck and have to kill yourself or remain trapped.

Loot is impossible to come by on the empty servers... I see people (who are probably hacking) with amazing guns and seemingly endless supplies of ammo, while it takes me about an hour or two of play just to find a basic gun in good condition.

The spawning system is particularly annoying: the prison spawn is ages away from anything good and takes too long to get away from. Also, players quite often ruin the game by boarding up useful buildings with the build tool. The devs claim that you can destroy player-made buildings, but you can't so if someone decides to do that (which they often do) the game is ruined. Oh, and they've ONLY JUST added in an option to change the graphics, although you still can't change mouse sensitivity, christ knows why.

This game needs much, much work before it'll be playable.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I made a review about this game awhile back and reccomended it. After a great deal of time after playing this, i have a huge change of heart.
THIS GAME IS NOT WORTH 5$!! its worth .99cents at most....
The game would be great if more poeple who talked and used their mics played it.
It's Always shoot first, talk later, if you see a guy run or just KOS, they don't wanna talk or be friends, most don't even speak english.
Your character dies too fast. it is impossible to get in a good 2 hours of gameplay without dying of thirst, hunger, or the worst of all, the cold weather.
You can't find  resources fast enough to keep your character healthy. you starve and dehydrate too quickly before you can even find food and water.
The freezing to death thing is annoying too. I had a character with thick jacket and a balaclava and i still froze to death!
There is no tutorials for building items as well.

The ways that the designers can make this game better.
1.) Get more english speaking players that are active using the mic
2.) Make it so you don't starve, dehydrate, or freeze to death as fast.
3.) Put more Loot or supplies, or have them respawn faster in buildings.
4.)Customizable character would be great too.
5.) please nerf the damage that dogs do, or give more health to characters.

If these changes are made i will make a recommended review again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have to start out by saying i think this game has some potential to be a good game. I played for 3 hours and really want to like it. It is different. I got frustrated by having absolutely no instructions listed anywhere and no way to what keys did what. It literally took me until the third hour to learn how to load a gun. I think it is because I didn't have the right ammo for any of the guns that i found. I eventually found a shotgun and found some shells. and reload was R".

I thought i had the right shells for the gun I was carrying but the caliber was not listed on the gun and the caliber listed with the bullets and clips were listed differently than I am used to. so it was hard to identify when I had the right ammo for the pistol I had. Also when you find thing you cannot carry enough items. this was very frustraing. Water is hard to find so I hoarded that....food was fairly simple to find but sometimes I would have to carry a can opener which I didn't want to carry due to inventory space.

You can die of starvation
date:
hunger and hypothermia. You start off with 6 inventory slots If you find water then definitely take it. 1 slot used. Find another water....well definitely take that. 2 slots used. Find food......alright found a can......3 slots. Oh.....need a can opener....found one 4 slots used........I am getting cold. I need an axe.....well that is a weapon so it doesn't count in my slots...that's good so I chop a tree and got a piece of wood 5 slots but now I need a lighter and a can fuel to ingnite the wood. That's 7 slots!. I did eventually find a back pack which expanded to up to 12 slots but I write that out to describe the frustration I felt when I knew I was getting h8ungry and thirsty fast and needing tyo hoard things but having to drop them just to continue on. Then thinking I can just go back for them to find that it respawned withing minutes of me finding them. DANG! it's not there now I am screwed.....now I die......and I start over with nothing.

I will try it again later and hope I will change my mind to give it a thumbs up. I certainly don't think I wasted my $5 because it is a really neat concept. I mostly wanted to offer feedback to the developers who seem to really be invested in making it a good game. IMHO......list some instructions like the basic key commands....it would have helped me out quite a bit.

"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So, I read that the game was finally being updated again and so I gathered some hope and downloaded this game again.
What should have not surprised me, did.
They stuck with the impossibly huge, open, pointless map.

In most singleplayer games, a huge open map is something that is desired, but in this game since servers can only have a max of 20 players and most servers don't have nowhere near that amount, it leads to a horrible game.

If you were around when this game first came out, you would know how ironically buggy the game was, but also how fun it was. I got 30 hours out of the game before it went to ♥♥♥♥. I was addicted to playing it 24/7. Then they decided to implement a "Tutorial area" which was utterly pointless and confusing.
They also added a new map with the "Tutorial"

This map ruined the game for me. It's the H1Z1 effect, you run forever just trying to find supplies, but guess what! There's not even zombies to fight. you explore the empty wilderness rarely coming across other players and that is the gist of this game.

Please don't purchase this game until they have made a smaller map that actually works. As always I will update my review in the future when I feel that this game has updated to a point worth mentioning.

EDIT:

I should have read the dev updates better. Apparently they seem to be changing the map to something else and updating tons of stuff, they just haven't implemented it yet.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My 30 minutes of playtime for this game was pretty bad.
-First, you spawn in the middle of nowhere, with no tutorial, no basic supplies, no direction whatsoever with what you are ACTUALLY supposed to be doing with your life.
-Within the first 5 minutes my character was already dying of thirst and starvation, with no food or water in sight.
-If you have a confrontation with a.. wild dog, wolf, whatever it is, good luck. Especially since you can't even punch the darn thing since the only thing you can use are weapons, which are few far and in between.
-I actually found the help menu, which shows what buttons to push to do what, but had to exit the game to actually find it. No in game help menu at all.
-The inventory menu is complicated to use. Not to mention you only have 6 free slots to stash stuff.
-The combat is choppy and just plain bad.
-You run across more ammo than you do guns(should be the other way around)
-When you actually do come across a gun, you can't tell if you have the right ammo for it anyways since none of it is written in english.


Morale of the story, don't buy this game. It has potential, but unless they make some MAJOR changes, it would be the worst $5 I've ever spent.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSo yes, this game is only $5 and I'd like to think that it has a lot of potential. But as of where the game stands right now, I can't recommend playing it. You're constantly getting killed before you can aquire any decent loot (either by players or wolves, since there is no melee attack). There doesn't seem to be enough loot for the amount of players on the server. Everytime you walk into a building there is more than likely another player in there, recently has been there, or walks in and kills you while you're in there. Even though I don't recommend it right now, I'd like to think, that over time, it will get much better.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

DO NOT BUY THIS.

As a fan of DayZ and other survival simulators, this is honestly the worst i've played. Shockingly, I'd happily play the abomination known as infestation survivor stories (WarZ) over this. Even though this is labelled as 'Early Access' it is not in a state to be released to the public. Some of my frustrations being:

- Controls can't be edited in game
- The ESC key returns you to the main menu
- The inventory system is clunky and makes no sense
- God awful generic jumping sound
- Constant ambient sounds from wildlife on loop (owls hooting etc!)
- Combat not fluid at all. Other players and wildlife sliding around.

Some may ask why the hell I even bothered buying this. Well the truth is that I was really hoping to have a decent DayZ alternative to play. After reading the store page, which painted an optimistic picture, and reading the majority of positive reviews, it seemed easy enough to part with low price point of a few quid. However, it's the same rubbish that we've all seen before. A game made on an ok engine which has a few standard features that you see in all DayZ clones and then put to market. I will not be making this mistake again!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Unfortunately I'm not reccomending this game, though here's my review.

Pros:

Price $5 can't beat it
Smooth gameplay
Customization is a plus
Maps are easy to understand
Possibly more good updates to come

Cons:
Much lag on almost every server
Inability to find matching loot in some towns for weaponry, or
just the inability to know what bullets match what gun.

Unable to see amount of ammunition in current weapon (that i know of)
No guidance what so ever on crafting
Small maps make for almost no loot (or the loot is based upon whoever is looting as I've learned my friend can't see the gear I see so possibility that loot is clientsided unless dropped by a player.

Unfriendly community as expected from a pvp game so that's sort of a pro makes it PVP friendly.

Survival threats are very low, cold, food, water, wolfs /dogs and players. Not much else to die from in terms of survival postapocalypse now" yeah.. not really apocalyptic either. Few broken down boats
recommended:
and that's really it some broken buildings. Not really apocalyptic looking.

Very boring after a few hours of gameplay due to very low population or inability to find loot.

Much hackers

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all. I will try to be fair here in the perspective as both a gamer and a fellow developer.

This is not a flame review nor a you guys suck review. It is more like some friendly critics that I hope you guys would notice in a good and friendly way. And take into consideration when you keep on developing on the game.

Gamer :

I would not recommend this to anyone in its current state. Item management is clumsy, Wildlife is clitchy as ♥♥♥♥.
Sound and GFX (Even on Fantastic) gives you a migrane after a few minutes.
Game seems way to small, i mean the few mins I have spent there it seems like i went from 1 invisible wall to another.

Would not recommend even if it was free to play, and I dont understand why people would play this, when Dayz. Rust, Ark etc. is on steam.

Developer.

As a open world" survival game 40 km2 is pretty small. Ones you are ingame it doesnt feel like 40 km2 at all though. it feels a lot smaller. Even though you announced that the game have a "Giant world with ability to keep up to 40 people on 1 server"
As a comparrison DayZ chernarus (Mod) with 40 players felt small and that is 225 km2.

You currently announce "Our game is almost in a finished state"

Current state of the game in a "normal" roadmap is alpha state.
The whole world need a redesign. roads overlapping each other in weird places
date:
trees halfway inside buildings/floawing 5-10 cm over the ground.

Props/assets needs a overhaul.
wildlife ai
hoursPlayed: UI and Hud needs a tweak

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Why the ♥♥♥♥ did I buy this game ? I do not know. To be honest, I've had A LOT more fun with free flash game websites. This game has potential, but it just plain sucks in its current state.

Pros:
+ has potential
+ can open drawers

Cons:
- is ugly
- is boring
- KOS worse than DayZ

The ULTIMATE con of this game, is the ESC keybinding ( that you cannot unbind ) that makes you leave the server EVERY time you press it.

Do NOT buy this game, even if during a massive sale.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Unfortunately I'm not reccomending this game, though here's my review.

Pros:

Price $5 can't beat it
Smooth gameplay
Customization is a plus
Maps are easy to understand
Possibly more good updates to come

Cons:
Much lag on almost every server
Inability to find matching loot in some towns for weaponry, or
just the inability to know what bullets match what gun.

Unable to see amount of ammunition in current weapon (that i know of)
No guidance what so ever on crafting
Small maps make for almost no loot (or the loot is based upon whoever is looting as I've learned my friend can't see the gear I see so possibility that loot is clientsided unless dropped by a player.

Unfriendly community as expected from a pvp game so that's sort of a pro makes it PVP friendly.

Survival threats are very low, cold, food, water, wolfs /dogs and players. Not much else to die from in terms of survival postapocalypse now" yeah.. not really apocalyptic either. Few broken down boats
recommended:
and that's really it some broken buildings. Not really apocalyptic looking.

Very boring after a few hours of gameplay due to very low population or inability to find loot.

Much hackers

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all. I will try to be fair here in the perspective as both a gamer and a fellow developer.

This is not a flame review nor a you guys suck review. It is more like some friendly critics that I hope you guys would notice in a good and friendly way. And take into consideration when you keep on developing on the game.

Gamer :

I would not recommend this to anyone in its current state. Item management is clumsy, Wildlife is clitchy as ♥♥♥♥.
Sound and GFX (Even on Fantastic) gives you a migrane after a few minutes.
Game seems way to small, i mean the few mins I have spent there it seems like i went from 1 invisible wall to another.

Would not recommend even if it was free to play, and I dont understand why people would play this, when Dayz. Rust, Ark etc. is on steam.

Developer.

As a open world" survival game 40 km2 is pretty small. Ones you are ingame it doesnt feel like 40 km2 at all though. it feels a lot smaller. Even though you announced that the game have a "Giant world with ability to keep up to 40 people on 1 server"
As a comparrison DayZ chernarus (Mod) with 40 players felt small and that is 225 km2.

You currently announce "Our game is almost in a finished state"

Current state of the game in a "normal" roadmap is alpha state.
The whole world need a redesign. roads overlapping each other in weird places
date:
trees halfway inside buildings/floawing 5-10 cm over the ground.

Props/assets needs a overhaul.
wildlife ai
hoursPlayed: UI and Hud needs a tweak

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I wanted to love this game; but there is a reason I only have 0.2 hrs on record. I have a fairly decent gaming computer. I can run skyrim at max settings with no issues at 65 FPS and the fans barly have to move to keep the computer cool. This game is an enigma of programming a bugs. I first played it at my sisters house for an hour, her computer has similar specs, and this game was crashing, FPS was all over the place, and items, vehicels, and fun are no where to be found.

I love the idea of the game. It has a great base that needs no further explaining other than  Its Russia
hoursPlayed: have fun". However the exucution was aweful. The devs simply gave up. The bugs won't be fixed. The gameplay won't be improved. People in their right mind won't play it. Don't waste five dollars. Hopefully someone else will take the game over and actualy do something with it. It has the potential to be a hit if they would at least try."

Horrible Horrible! Wouldnt be bad if they actually done a few simple things to make game worth a damn! For one and prolly the most ridiculous of all is the inventory storage lol it is pathetic you can only carry very few items! sure you may find a gun but oops no room for a small box of ammo?! or if you have that guess what your not gonna eat or drink cause theres no room to carry the crap! reviewText:
Early Access Review

Spent the entire time walking after I got out of the prison. Explored a pretty decent portion of the map, found nothing, ran in to a couple of others who seemed to be doing the same thing (just... walking around), beat two dogs to death with the torch, and then quit the game.
For an early access game, it's in pretty good shape. However, there were a good number of bugs that I encountered in my short time playing. In the prison, I respawned randomly to the cell you start out in. Walking up sets of stairs is not possible - you have to jump up them. The dogs I encountered had no actual movements, they just glided towards me and stood next to me, stationary, as I took damage. I went to the backside of a mountain range - which disapeared with the exception of the top portion. I could not close my inventory one of the times that I opened it, so I pressed escape, thinking that would solve the problem - it booted me from the server.
There is no tutorial for this game, they just throw you into it and expect that you know what to do. To be fair, it seems like it's easy to get the hang of, but you have to figure everything out yourself. The controls are fine for me, but from what I gathered from other reviewers, if you're not into using the traditional layout for FPS games, then you're out of luck as you cannot rebind the keys.

Some good aspects of the game would be the overall graphics, which look decent for a five dollar game. The voice acting (so far - I've only heard my character speak) is decent as well. That's really all that comes to mind though, unfortunately...
Overall, I just can't recommend this game. It looks like it would be really good, but it needs more time spent in development. The devs should really focus on implementing things for the player to do, rather than essentially making it a walking simulator. Hopefully I can come back to this game in the future and give it another shot.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Saw this game on steam about two weeks ago. With the price tag of 5.99 usd I figured I would give it a try even though I wasn't expection much from it. It started me off in a prison. After leaving there I traveled to two new locations. I starte looting stuff in draws, cabints, lockers, and such like other games do(dayz standalone). The game wasn't to bad until I started running into other players. Most had top tier gear and was just camping the noob area. So I died, died, died, and died so more. Couldn't leave the noob area and if I did, I would get killed by a player not long away.

---Pros---
-The loot system is good for a game of this price.
Good amount of items/guns/tools.
-When you go to other locations, it is it's own instance.

---Cons---
-Players camping new player locations with top tier gear.
-Hard to play alone on servers with more players on them.


So would I suggest this game to anyone? If you like pvp survival games like dayz and just kos then this is for you. It's on 5.99 usd atm and if you don't like it after playing for less then 2 hours, you can ask for a refund like I did from steam.
So I give the game a 4/10 for the looting/instance travel.

Early Access Review

The game started out well, but sadly the game isn't worth it yet.

Pros:
Good players
Beutiful graphics(if you set the settings high enough and you have a good pc)
Ok loot but not enough
It's great beacause you can see your feet and legs if you look down, I mean every gameshould be like that!(good job devs)

Cons:
Not enough loot
Hunger and Thirst go down way too fast
Buggy AI for animals
Strange health bug after you die when you have super low health
You are invincible if you get into vehicles(only one I've seen is the tractor)


Over all it's a good game and if you want to support the devs just go ahead and get the game while its cheap, Trust me, when this game is finished it will be awesome and probably more exspensive, but if it stays like the way it is right now, Don't get it yet.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Spent the entire time walking after I got out of the prison. Explored a pretty decent portion of the map, found nothing, ran in to a couple of others who seemed to be doing the same thing (just... walking around), beat two dogs to death with the torch, and then quit the game.
For an early access game, it's in pretty good shape. However, there were a good number of bugs that I encountered in my short time playing. In the prison, I respawned randomly to the cell you start out in. Walking up sets of stairs is not possible - you have to jump up them. The dogs I encountered had no actual movements, they just glided towards me and stood next to me, stationary, as I took damage. I went to the backside of a mountain range - which disapeared with the exception of the top portion. I could not close my inventory one of the times that I opened it, so I pressed escape, thinking that would solve the problem - it booted me from the server.
There is no tutorial for this game, they just throw you into it and expect that you know what to do. To be fair, it seems like it's easy to get the hang of, but you have to figure everything out yourself. The controls are fine for me, but from what I gathered from other reviewers, if you're not into using the traditional layout for FPS games, then you're out of luck as you cannot rebind the keys.

Some good aspects of the game would be the overall graphics, which look decent for a five dollar game. The voice acting (so far - I've only heard my character speak) is decent as well. That's really all that comes to mind though, unfortunately...
Overall, I just can't recommend this game. It looks like it would be really good, but it needs more time spent in development. The devs should really focus on implementing things for the player to do, rather than essentially making it a walking simulator. Hopefully I can come back to this game in the future and give it another shot.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I want to love this game. I really do. It has so many things i love in a game. PVP, character customization to for starters.
but there are so many glitches it makes it hard.
I fully understand it's in the early stages but the lag and is unbearable at times. Spending an hour collecting gear only to be killed by something that is not in the room or missing a point blank shot to the head with a shotgun is beyond frustrating.

With all the issues i keep finding myself going back to play a few rounds every week.

Whats with being able to build a house? Does anyone actually do that? Seems a silly feature for this game. The game would be better if they focused on speeding up the game instead.


I give it a 5/10 but with a few tweaks it could be much harder. Give it a few months and I'll re evaluate the game but right now It's far from a finished product
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So much potential. For a 5 dollar game it aint all bad. The gameplay is a bit wonky. Stats go down too fast, Loot system is akward, and meeting up with friends is a chore. Also there is no real threats besides the enviorment and players. Besides that it has a cool setting with a voiced character and runs very smoothly despite its huge map.

Overall Verdict: 5/10 (wasted potential)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Many reviewers say the dev is an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ who doesn't care for his community and has abondoned this game. This is now untrue. He has realised that people didn't like his decision and now he will continue working on SPN.

This game is basically a cheap DayZ, but it is great especially for the price and instead of needing a NASA computer all you will need is your grandma's old dusty desktop to run it. The graphics look good enough (especially on max), gameplay is suspenseful but repetitive, and there are many glitches (none are game breaking it seems). At the moment there are only 3 enemies. Wolves of varying colors, bears, and players. Sounds boring right? I know but its actually pretty fun/addictive imo. You will either love it or hate it, but atleast you can refund if you hate it. Oh and there is no text chat.. so you better have a mic.

7/10

Early Access Review

Early Access Review

I havent played a whole lot of this game but so far its pretty good for the summer sale price anyway ($4.94) .
Its pretty straight forward and easily understood as in there doesnt seem to be a lot of hidden types of crafting
like RUST, MISCREATED, THE FOREST and so on. The server i was on ran smooth and i had a steady 100fps with
no lag noticed. Keeping in mind this is early access i hope more things will get add like easier access to drinkable
fluids cuz that was one thing that annoyed me only finding one can of soup and one bottle of what looked like
gatorade lol. I came across 3 people in the short time i played...2 friendly...1 very agressive russian that i couldnt
understand and had to kill or be killed lol. Anyway..for the price try it out, i was unsure to and at this point i dont
regret my purchase. Hope you enjoy :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Wow, I really should have done what other reviewers suggested and not bought this game.
I went into it with an open mind, and I may only have 10 minutes of ''played time'' but that's more than enough.
Stupid controls, 5 different buttons on my keyboard opened the inventory/menu.
No idea what to do or how to do it.
Here's the rundown of 10 minutes ingame.

I picked the lock on the door, game crashed.
Picked it again, tried to open another door, game crashed.
Finally exited starting area, stood there looking at nothing, as the graphics wouldn't load up.
Got refund.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I havent played a whole lot of this game but so far its pretty good for the summer sale price anyway ($4.94) .
Its pretty straight forward and easily understood as in there doesnt seem to be a lot of hidden types of crafting
like RUST, MISCREATED, THE FOREST and so on. The server i was on ran smooth and i had a steady 100fps with
no lag noticed. Keeping in mind this is early access i hope more things will get add like easier access to drinkable
fluids cuz that was one thing that annoyed me only finding one can of soup and one bottle of what looked like
gatorade lol. I came across 3 people in the short time i played...2 friendly...1 very agressive russian that i couldnt
understand and had to kill or be killed lol. Anyway..for the price try it out, i was unsure to and at this point i dont
regret my purchase. Hope you enjoy :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was expecting a good game from all the steam reviews I read and videos I watched, and I got more than that.
This game may not seem like a dayz killer, but to me it is. The atmosphere is crazy, the designs of towns and other landmarks really resemble the apocalypse, rusty and old.
I was in a building checking a fridge casually with my axe I found and I heard someone running past the window, it was night in game and 1:30am in real life, out of all games I played in my life, nothing scared me as much as this game so far has, I can highly recommend this to everyone and it's really cheap, you can't go wrong.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Currently, the game I play the most. It still has bugs, but gets constant updates and overall is very addictive.

Pros:
+ Many weapons, ammo types, and some attachments.
+ Many clothes
+ Voice chat (you should learn Russian).
+ Big Map
+ Team Death Match mode, nice to have someone who doesn't try to kill you on sight.

Cons:
- Not so much different items to loot
- Defenseless with your bare hands
- Hard to survive in the beginning
- If you die, you loose everything
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has a lot of potential to be one of the best survival games in contemporary market. Although it's still in alfa, but you can find tons of different loot (weapons, clothes, food etc) and make harsh environment more friendly. But the main reason is to survive trough getting constantly : thirsty, hungry and especially cold. You have to battle all the time to be sure to keep those 3 stats ant None and 36.6 value. Second if hunger or cold won't kill you, angry russians will (and a ton fo wolves and couple bears :D). PVP in this game is really realistic and encourages players to communicate with each other to overcome together every obstacle you meet in this game.

But as for now this game has quite a lot of bugs :
Random teleportation through the map, or even to another server
You can't (yet) destroy other players wood house, they exploit it to block entrance to looting areas (houses and etc)
Most importantly HACKERS - they can even ban you via spectator console and you will see the infamous cat in the jar" rather than actually play the game. Second in starting areas alot of people are using AR's or M4A1's with unlimited ammo or other sort of advantage. These things seriously impact the overall performance of the game... Hope Devs will fix these things..

But overall - Would recommend this game 11/10 cause of angry russians and harsh environment
"

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSurvival: Postapocalypse Now, is STALKER, Mixed with DayZ. It has huge potential, and even now it is a really fun game to play with friends. The looting is really original and fun, The Shooting is quite solid and works well, The graphics are surprisingly good. Overall, I loved the game. If it keeps getting updated, then this game could be one of the top selling Survival games out there! :)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI wasn't sure about this game at first only because of its cheap price. I decided to go ahead and give it a try and I'm loving it so far. It definitely has its problems but the devs are constantly working on bug fixes and updates. The devs are also active on the discussion threads and take everyones suggestions to mind. Overall, I think this is a great game that can easily compete with some of the larger competitors like DayZ or Rust. Everyone should try this game if you enjoy survival games.
